-name: Deploy changed courses
+name: Generate commands to deploy changed courses
 
 on:
   workflow_dispatch:  # Allows manual triggering of the workflow
@@ -21,4 +21,66 @@ jobs:
             echo "Error: Environment must be one of 'dev', 'demo', 'prod'"
             exit 1
           fi
-        shell: bash
\ No newline at end of file
+        shell: bash
+
+  download_latest_draft_release_artifacts:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    needs: validate-input
+    outputs:
+      changes: ${{ steps.curriculum_report.outputs.changes }}
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout repository
+        uses: actions/checkout@v4
+
+      - name: Install GitHub CLI
+        run: sudo apt update && sudo apt install gh
+      
+      - name: Download artifact from the latest draft release
+        run: |
+          LATEST_DRAFT_TAG=$(gh release list --json isDraft,tagName --jq '.[] | select(.isDraft == true) | .tagName' --limit 1)
+          echo "$LATEST_DRAFT_TAG"
+          echo "LATEST_DRAFT_TAG=$LATEST_DRAFT_TAG" >> $GITHUB_ENV
+          gh release download "$LATEST_DRAFT_TAG"
+        env:
+          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
+
+      - name: Unzip artifacts
+        run: |
+          unzip files.zip -d ./files && echo "Directories after unzipping:" && ls -l ./files
+
+      - name: Read git-diff-changes.md and set content as output
+        id: curriculum_report
+        run: |
+          CONTENT=$(cat files/deploys/$LATEST_DRAFT_TAG/git-diff-changes.md)
+          ENCODED_CONTENT=$(echo "$CONTENT" | base64 | tr -d '\n')
+          echo "changes=$ENCODED_CONTENT" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
+
+  process_changes:
+    needs: download_latest_draft_release_artifacts
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    env: 
+      CHANGES: ${{ needs.download_latest_draft_release_artifacts.outputs.changes }}
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout repository
+        uses: actions/checkout@v4
+
+      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
+        id: setup-python
+        with:
+          python-version: "3.9"
+      
+      - uses: actions/cache@v4
+        id: cache-virtualenv
+        with:
+          path: ".virtualenv"
+          key: "python-${{ steps.setup-python.outputs.python-version }}-${{ hashFiles('requirements.txt') }}"
+
+      # If we weren't able to pull down a cache of the virtual environment then build one.
+      - if: steps.cache-virtualenv.outputs.cache-hit != 'true'
+        run: make --no-print-directory require-virtualenv
+
+      - name: Deploy course
+        run: |
+          chmod +x tools/changes_deploy.py
+          OUTPUT=$(python3 tools/changes_deploy.py --changes $CHANGES --env ${{ github.event.inputs.environment }} 2>&1)
+          echo "$OUTPUT"
\ No newline at end of file

+import argparse
+import logging
+import base64
+from data.curriculum_change import *
+
+def parse_arguments():
+    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Process params.")
+    parser.add_argument("-changes", "--changes", required=True, help="Git changes")
+    parser.add_argument("-env", "--environment", required=True, help="Environment (demo, dev, prod)")
+    return parser.parse_args()
+
+def parse_data_to_objects(data):
+    courses_dict = {}
+    
+    for line in data.strip().split("\n"):
+        parts = line.split()
+        if len(parts) < 2 or not parts[1].startswith("courses/"):
+            continue  # Skip irrelevant lines
+
+        action, path = parts[0], parts[1]
+        path_components = path.split('/')
+        course_name = path_components[1]
+
+        # Initialize course if not exists
+        if course_name not in courses_dict:
+            courses_dict[course_name] = Course(course_name)
+
+        course = courses_dict[course_name]
+
+        # Change directly in the course (e.g., course.json)
+        if len(path_components) == 3 and path_components[2] == "course.json":
+            course.changed_files.append(CurriculumChange(action, course_name, path))
+            continue
+
+        # Changes within projects
+        if len(path_components) > 3 and path_components[2] == "projects":
+            project_name = path_components[3]
+            project = course.get_project(project_name)
+
+            # If project doesn't exist, initialize and add it to the course
+            if project is None:
+                project = Project(project_name)
+                course.add_project(project)
+            
+            project.changed_paths.append('/'.join(path_components[3:]))
+
+    # Convert dictionary to list of courses for easier handling outside this function
+    courses_list = list(courses_dict.values())
+
+    return courses_list
+
+def main():
+    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
+    logging.info(" Running changes_deploy.py")
+    args = parse_arguments()
+
+    decoded_data = base64.b64decode(args.changes)
+    decoded_string = decoded_data.decode('utf-8')
+
+    escaped_changes = decoded_string.replace(" ", "\s")
+    courses = parse_data_to_objects(escaped_changes)
+
+    demo_env_cmds=""
+    prod_env_cmds=""
+    logging.info(" Printing list of courses:")
+    i = 1
+    for course in courses:
+        logging.info(f"  {i}. {course.name}")
+        i += 1
+        
+        projects_arguments = ""
+        for project in course.projects:
+            projects_arguments += f"--project {project.name} "
+        
+        demo_env_cmds += f"   sh deploy/tools/deploy-course-to-environment.sh --course {course.name} --environment demo --allow-demo {projects_arguments}\n\n"
+        prod_env_cmds += f"   sh deploy/tools/deploy-course-to-environment.sh --course {course.name} --environment prod {projects_arguments}\n\n"
+
+    logging.info(" ")
+    logging.info(" ----------")
+    logging.info(" ")
+    logging.info(f" DEMO environment cmds:\n{demo_env_cmds}")
+    logging.info(" ----------")
+    logging.info(" ")
+    logging.info(f" PROD environment cmds (needs to manually add '--allow-prod'):\n{prod_env_cmds}")
+    logging.info(" ----------")
+
+
+if __name__ == "__main__":
+    main()

+class CurriculumChange:
+    def __init__(self, action, course_name, changed_file=None):
+        self.action = action
+        self.course_name = course_name
+        self.changed_file = changed_file
+
+class Course:
+    def __init__(self, name):
+        self.name = name
+        self.projects = []
+        self.changed_files = []
+
+    def add_project(self, project):
+        # Check if project already exists, if not add it
+        if not any(p.name == project.name for p in self.projects):
+            self.projects.append(project)
+
+    def get_project(self, project_name):
+        # Find project in list, or return None
+        for project in self.projects:
+            if project.name == project_name:
+                return project
+        return None
+
+class Project:
+    def __init__(self, name):
+        self.name = name
+        self.changed_paths = []

+  if [ "${#projects[@]}" -eq 0 ]; then
+    # If no projects are explicitly passed, find them based on the course directory structure
+    ls -1 courses/${course}/projects/*/project.json |
+    awk -v FS='/' '{ print $4 }' |
+    while read project; do
+      id=$(cat courses/${course}/projects/${project}/project.json 2>/dev/null | jq -r '.id')
+      echo "${project} ${id}"
+    done | sort
+  else
+    # Handle passed projects
+    for project in "${projects[@]}"; do
+      echo "${project}"
+    done
+  fi

@@ -0,0 +1,58 @@
+import logging
+import time
+import functools
+import inspect
+import os
+
+log_level = os.getenv('LOG_LEVEL', 'NONE')
+
+if log_level != 'NONE':
+    handlers = [
+      logging.FileHandler('execution_logs.md'),
+      logging.StreamHandler()
+    ]
+    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s - %(message)s', handlers=handlers)
+
+class Logger:
+    """To monitor logs: tail -f execution_logs.md"""
+    log_file_path = 'execution_logs.md'
+
+    @staticmethod
+    def _log_to_file(message):
+        with open(Logger.log_file_path, 'a') as log_file:
+            log_file.write(message + '\n')
+    
+    @staticmethod
+    def log(message):
+        if log_level == 'DEBUG' or log_level == 'INFO':
+          logging.info(message)
+          Logger._log_to_file(message)
+    
+    @staticmethod
+    def log_method_execution_time(method):
+        """Decorator to log the execution time of a method."""
+        if log_level != 'DEBUG':
+            # If not in DEBUG mode, return the method unchanged
+            return method
+        
+        @functools.wraps(method)
+        def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):
+            stack_depth = len(inspect.stack()) - 1
+            file_path = inspect.getfile(method)
+            if 'tools' in file_path:
+                trimmed_path = file_path[file_path.index('tools'):]
+            else:
+                trimmed_path = file_path
+            
+            start_time = time.time()
+            result = method(*args, **kwargs)
+            end_time = time.time()
+
+            execution_time = end_time - start_time
+
+            log_message = f" {trimmed_path}.{method.__name__} executed in {execution_time:.4f} seconds. Stack level({stack_depth})"
+            Logger.log(log_message)
+            
+            return result
+
+        return wrapper
